page.title: 04Stanwell continued
page.content:
At the end of the war there was a chronic shortage of houses in London. Families were moved out of London and into the surrounding countryside. Houses were built at the end of Stanwell nearest to Staines. Heathrow was not very big at this time and gradually as it was expanded more men were needed. This meant that houses were needed so more were built. Today, Heathrow and all its associates are still the main employers of the area .
{Recreation.}Stanwell has four parks, Oaks road park, Lauser park, The Church park and Cordelia park. Cordelia park has a professional cricket pitch, on which you can usually find a game of cricket being played at weekends. It also has an Air Cadet Corps stationed there.
